702749f-b.title: Brooklyn: 40th Street (East) - Kings Highway
702749f-b.text:
(1)
East 40th Street, west side, between Alton Plaoe and King's Eighway,
showing the Flatlands Dutch Reformed Church and Sunday School.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUEED.
(2)
The same, a view from Overbaugh Lane.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, showing a close-up of the Church.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

702747f-b.title: Brooklyn: 40th Street (East) - Kings Highway
702747f-b.text:
(1)
East 40th Street, west side, north from King's Highway. A view of the
Flatlands Dutch Reform Church, and its Cemetery, dating from the 17th century.
April 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing headstones of several members of the Schenck family
interred in the cemetery partially seen in view one. Note headstones
spelled with the name Schenky.
About 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

705242f-b.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 40th Street (East)
705242f-b.text:
(1)
Eings HighWay, north side, west from East 40th Street. Also on
the right, is East 40th Street, west side, north from Kings Highway.
A view of the Flatlands Dutch Reformed Church, erected 1847-8; the
building at the left being its Sunday School.
April 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Same, from a different angle; note change in foreground.
August 7, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, close-up of the church proper.
August 7, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

705243f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 40th Street (East)
705243f-a.text:
Kings Highway, at the N.. corner of East 40th Street. A view of the
Platlands Dutch Reformed Church and Sunday School.
April 27, 1931.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
Two Norway maple trees dedicated to the ancestors of the Van Voorhees
and Wyckoff families, who as colonists worshiped in this church, were
planted yesterday in the graveyard adjoining the church, according to the
New York Times of May 23, 1938.

702745f-a.title: Brooklyn: 40th Street (East) - Kings Highway
702745f-a.text:
(1)
East 40th Street, west side, north of Kings Highway, showing the
Flatlands Dutch Reformed Church. This church was founded February
9, 1654. The first edifice was erected in 1663, the second in 1793
and the third and present one in 1848.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, from another angle.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, showing the Sunday School only.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

705244f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 40th Street (East)
705244f-a.text:
Kings Pighway, northfrom East 40th Street, showing Capt. Albert Emmonhs'
Pouse at the extreme right, built by him in 1856. This house later became
the Joseph Fleming House. The entire row of houses were demolished in
May 1925.
March 1925.
Eugene L, Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

705246f-a.text:

705247f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 40th Street (East)
705247f-a.text:
Kings Highway, west side, between East 40th Street and Mill Lane,
showing the T. Garretson House, occupied by that family since 1857 and
destroyed in May 1925.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

705249f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 40th Street (East)
705249f-a.text:
4005 Kings Highway, at the N.E. corner of East 40th Street, showing
the J. B. Pendrickson youse, known once as No. 60 Kouwenhoven Lane. It
was occupied by the Hendrickson family until 1873 and later by John Hegeman,
whose family still occupy it.
March 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
NAY BE REPRODUCED.
